newsitem.title: UK: Lloyds firms on broker upgrades.
newsitem.headline: Lloyds firms on broker upgrades.

text.p: Shares in Lloyds TSB Group Plc firmed in a generally weaker broad market on Thursday, as three leading brokerages upgraded the stock, dealers said.
AT 0820 GMT, Lloyds shares were up 7p to 612-1/2. They were among the most actively traded in London.

Merrill Lynch raised its recommendation on Lloyds to a long- and short-term "buy" from a long- and short-term "accumulate." The brokerage also nudged up its earnings forecasts for 1997 and 1998, citing improved margins, strength in Lloyds' mortgage business and costs savings from its merger with TSB.
SBC Warburg upgraded the stock to "buy" from "hold," also raising its earnings estimates. Details weren't available.
ABN AMRO Hoare Govett also upgraded the stock, though details were not immediately available. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 5106
